intro: Comaropsis pedata, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Comaropsis pedata is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
